Title: Please go up the stairs, and go to the right
Kanji: 店員: いらさいませ。
アンナ: あのう、マンガ　売り場　は　どこ　です　か。
店員: 2階 です。階段 を 上がって、右 に 行って ください
Kana: 店員: いらさいませ。
アンナ：あのう、マンガ　うりば　は　どこ　です　か。
店員:　にかい です。かいだん　を　あがて、みぎ　に　いって　ください
Romaji: Anna: Anou, Manga uriba wa doko desu ka.
Ten'in: Nikai desu. Kaidan o agatte, migi ni itte kudasai.
English: Anna:　Excuse me, Where is the manga section?
Clerk: Second floor. Please go up the stairs, and go to the right.
Vocabulary: - 売り場 (うりば - Uriba): Section
- 階段 (かいだん - Kaidan): Stairs
- あがて (Agatte): Te form of the verb あがります(Agarimasu) => To go up
- 行って (いって - Itte): Te form of the verb いきます(Ikimasu) => To go
Description: に has many uses and meanings.
If the verb in the predicate of a sentece expresses the existance of something such as います(Imasu - To be, to exists)
に(Ni) indicates where something is or exists:
- わたし　わ　えき　に　います　(Watashi wa eki ni imasu) = I am at the station
If the predicate verb eexpresses a movement or a change like いきます　(Ikimasu - To go),
に(Ni) indicates the terminating point of the movement:
- わたし　わ　えき　に　いきます　(Watashi wa eki ni ikimasu) = I go to the station
に(Ni) also indicates a specific point in time, such as a date or clock time:
- アンナ　は　じゅうじ　に　きます　(Anna wa juuji ni kimasu) = Anna comes at ten o'clock
We can't use に(Ni) with words such as あした (Ashita - Tomorrow) or next week:
- アンナ　は　あした　きます (Anna wa ahista kimasu) = Anan will come tomorrow.
